verses.arabic_tajweed_html: نٓ‌ۚ وَٱلْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ ١
verses.bangla: Nun By the pen! By all they write!

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: مَآ أَنتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ ٢
verses.bangla: Your Lord’s grace does not make you [Prophet] a madman:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ ٣
verses.bangla: you will have a never-ending reward––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ ٤
verses.bangla: truly you have a strong character––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ ٥
verses.bangla: and soon you will see, as will they,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: بِأَييِّكُمُ ٱلْمَفْتُونُ ٦
verses.bangla: which of you is afflicted with madness.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ ٧
verses.bangla: Your Lord knows best who strays from His path and who is rightly guided.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ ٨
verses.bangla: So do not yield to those who deny the truth––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَدُّواْ لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ ٩
verses.bangla: they want you to compromise with them and then they will compromise with you––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَّهِينٍ ١٠
verses.bangla: do not yield to any contemptible swearer,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: هَمَّازٍ مَّشَّآءِۭ بِنَمِيمٍ ١١
verses.bangla: to any backbiter, slander-monger,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: مَّنَّاعٍ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ ١٢
verses.bangla: or hinderer of good, to anyone who is sinful, aggressive,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: عُتُلِّۭ بَعْدَ ذَٲلِكَ زَنِيمٍ ١٣
verses.bangla: coarse, and on top of all that, an imposter.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَن كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ ١٤
verses.bangla: Just because he has wealth and sons,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ ١٥
verses.bangla: when our revelations are recited to him, he says, ‘These are just ancient fables.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: سَنَسِمُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلْخُرْطُومِ ١٦
verses.bangla: We shall brand him on the snout!

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُواْ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ ١٧
verses.bangla: We have tried them as We tried the owners of a certain garden, who swore that they would harvest its fruits in the morning

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ ١٨
verses.bangla: and made no allowance [for the Will of God]:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ ١٩
verses.bangla: a disaster from your Lord struck the garden as they slept

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَٱلصَّرِيمِ ٢٠
verses.bangla: and by morning it was stripped bare, a desolate land.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَتَنَادَوْاْ مُصْبِحِينَ ٢١
verses.bangla: Still they called each other at daybreak,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَنِ ٱغْدُواْ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ ٢٢
verses.bangla: ‘Go early to your field if you wish to gather all its fruits,’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَٱنطَلَقُواْ وَهُمْ يَتَخَـٰفَتُونَ ٢٣
verses.bangla: and went off, whispering,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ ٢٤
verses.bangla: ‘Make sure no poor person enters the garden today!’––

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَغَدَوْاْ عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَـٰدِرِينَ ٢٥
verses.bangla: they left early, bent on their purpose-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا لَضَآلُّونَ ٢٦
verses.bangla: but when they saw the garden, they said, ‘We must have lost our way!

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ ٢٧
verses.bangla: No- we are ruined!’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ ٢٨
verses.bangla: The wisest of them said, ‘Did I not say to you, “Will you not glorify God?”’-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قَالُواْ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ ٢٩
verses.bangla: they said, ‘Glory be to God, Our Lord! Truly, we were doing wrong!’-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَـٰوَمُونَ ٣٠
verses.bangla: and then they turned to each other in mutual reproach.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قَالُواْ يَـٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا طَـٰغِينَ ٣١
verses.bangla: They said, ‘Alas for us! We have done terrible wrong,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٲغِبُونَ ٣٢
verses.bangla: but maybe our Lord will give us something better in its place: we truly turn to Him in hope.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: كَذَٲلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ‌ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْأَخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ‌ۚ لَوْ كَانُواْ يَعْلَمُونَ ٣٣
verses.bangla: Such is the punishment [in this life], but greater still is the punishment in the Hereafter, if only they knew.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ ٣٤
verses.bangla: There will be Gardens of bliss for those who are mindful of God.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَفَنَجْعَلُ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ كَٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ ٣٥
verses.bangla: Should We treat those who submit to Us as We treat those who do evil?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ ٣٦
verses.bangla: What is the matter with you? On what basis do you judge?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَـٰبٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ ٣٧
verses.bangla: Do you have a Scripture that tells you

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ ٣٨
verses.bangla: that you will be granted whatever you choose?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ‌ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ ٣٩
verses.bangla: Have you received from Us solemn oaths, binding to the Day of Resurrection, that you will get whatever you yourselves decide?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُم بِذَٲلِكَ زَعِيمٌ ٤٠
verses.bangla: Ask them [Prophet] which of them will guarantee this.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُواْ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُواْ صَـٰدِقِينَ ٤١
verses.bangla: Do they have ‘partners’ [besides God]? Let them produce their ‘partners’, if what they say is true.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ ٤٢
verses.bangla: On the Day when matters become dire, they will be invited to prostrate themselves but will be prevented from doing so,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ‌ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُواْ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ ٤٣
verses.bangla: and their eyes will be downcast and they will be overwhelmed with shame: they were invited to prostrate themselves when they were safe [but refused].

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ‌ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ٤٤
verses.bangla: So [Prophet] leave those who reject this revelation to Me: We shall lead them on, step by step, in ways beyond their knowledge;

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأُمْلِى لَهُمْ‌ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِى مَتِينٌ ٤٥
verses.bangla: I will allow them more time, for My plan is powerful.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَمْ تَسْــَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ ٤٦
verses.bangla: Do you demand some reward from them that would burden them with debt?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: أَمْ عِندَهُمُ ٱلْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ ٤٧
verses.bangla: Do they have knowledge of the unseen that enables them to write it down?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ ٤٨
verses.bangla: Wait patiently [Prophet] for your Lord’s judgement: do not be like the man in the whale who called out in distress:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٲرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ ٤٩
verses.bangla: if his Lord’s grace had not reached him, he would have been left, abandoned and blameworthy, on the barren shore,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَٱجْتَبَـٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَجَعَلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ ٥٠
verses.bangla: but his Lord chose him and made him one of the Righteous.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُواْ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ ٥١
verses.bangla: The disbelievers almost strike you down with their looks when they hear the Quran. They say, ‘He must be mad!’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ ٥٢
verses.bangla: but truly it is nothing other than a Reminder for all peoples.
